description: From Middle French votif, from Latin vōtīvus (“votive”), from vōtum (“vow”).

adjectives.description: votive (comparative more votive, superlative most votive)

entries.meaning: Dedicated or given in fulfillment of a vow or pledge.
examples: She placed a votive offering at the shrine.

entries.meaning: Of, expressing, or symbolizing a vow. Often used to describe thick cylindrical candles found in many churches, lit when making a private vow or asking a private intention.
examples: The church was lit by votive candles.

entries.meaning: (music) a hymn or chant dedicated to a particular saint, or to the Virgin Mary
